snippet.title: A VLSI fuzzy logic controller with reconfigurable, cascadable architecture
snippet.description:
* A VLSI fuzzy logic controller with reconfigurable, cascadable architecture (Citations: 133)
HIROY UKI WATANABE, WAYNE D. DETTLOFF, KATHY E. YOUNT
A general-purpose fuzzy logic inference engine for real-time control applications, designed and fabricated in a 1.1-Î¼m, 3.3-V, double-level-metal CMOS technology, is discussed. Up to 102 rules are processed in parallel with a single 688 K transistor device. Features include a dynamically reconfigurable and cascadable architecture, TTL-compatible host interface, laser-programmable redundancy, ...
Journal: IEEE Journal of Solid-state Circuits - IEEE J SOLID-STATE CIRCUITS , vol. 25, no. 2, pp. 376-382, 1990

snippet.title: Cyclic AMP--An Intracellular Second Messenger for Interleukin 1
snippet.description:
* Cyclic AMP--An Intracellular Second Messenger for Interleukin 1 (Citations: 43)
Fumihiko Shirakawa, Uki Yamashita, Marcio Chedid, Steven B. Mizel
We demonstrated that interleukin 1 (IL-1), a potent peptide mediator in immune and inflammatory responses, stimulates the synthesis of cAMP in a variety of IL-1-responsive cell targets. We also showed that cAMP analogs and cAMP-inducing agents can replace IL-1 in the induction of interleukin 2 receptors on lymphocytes as well as in phytohemagglutinin-induced murine ...
Journal: Proceedings of The National Academy of Sciences - PNAS , vol. 85, no. 21, pp. 8201-8205, 1988

Takeshi Fujisaki, Yoshiya Tanaka, Koichi Fujii, Shinichiro Mine, Kazuyoshi Saito, Shinwa Yamada, Uki Yamashita, Tatsuro Irimura, Sumiya Eto
For cancer metastasis, tumor cells present in the circulation must first adhere to the endothelium. Integrins lymphocyte function-associated an- tigen (LFA) 1 and very late antigen 4 play a central role in leukocyte adhesion to the endothelium and subsequent migration into tissues. The majority of tumor cells derived from solid cancers including colorectal cancer do not express suitable adhesion ...
Published in 1999.

snippet.title: Biphasic changes in behavioral, endocrine, and sympathetic systems in adjuvant arthritis in Lewis rats
snippet.description:
* Biphasic changes in behavioral, endocrine, and sympathetic systems in adjuvant arthritis in Lewis rats (Citations: 30)
Hiroaki Tanaka, Yoichi Ueta, Uki Yamashita, Hiroshi Kannan, Hiroshi Yamashita
Adjuvant arthritis (AA) is an experimental model for rheumatoid arthritis, and is induced most easily in inbred Lewis rats by an intradermal injection of heat-killed Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MT) in incomplete Freund's adjuvant. Susceptivity to the arthritis in Lewis rats is thought to be related to a defect in their responses of the hypothalamo-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis to ...
Journal: Brain Research Bulletin - BRAIN RES BULL , vol. 39, no. 1, pp. 33-37, 1996
